intro: Coleataenia longifolia subsp. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved coleataenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants characterized by their spathaceous inflorescences. The species is distinguished by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in a spathe. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
